Time-Saving Services

It's time to get excited!

Have more time for You!

Let me tell you a short story.

Vacation
You need a vacation, yet you don't have one. Why? It's simply because you have too much work.
Too Much Work
You have too much work because you are understaffed. (I have news for you. Most companies are grossly understaffed because of Moore's Law. Technology is growing too fast for most businesses to keep up.)
Understaffed
You're understaffed, and why are you understaffed? It's simply because you don't have enough money to afford more employees. Where is the money going? How come you can't afford your business' basic needs - your employees - even though you're a large profitable company?
You Need More Cash

The reason you can't afford more workers is because your marketing eats up a large chunk of your company's budget.

... The survey found that marketing budgets remained healthy in 2014, with, on average, companies spending 10.2 percent of their annual 2014 revenue on overall marketing activities, with 50 percent of companies planning an increase in 2015. Digital marketing spending averaged one-quarter of the marketing budget in 2014. The survey found that of the 51 percent of companies who plan to increase their digital marketing budget in 2015, the average increase will be 17 percent.

— Source: Gartner

50% of the companies they surveyed increased their up marketing budget from 10.2% to almost 12% in 2015 [10.2 + 17%], that's over 1/10th of the entire company budget! Gartner sourced that information from companies with at least $500M in annual revenue. To put it bluntly, they increased their marketing budget up from $51M to $59.67M for an increase of $8.67M! I don't know about you, but I'd love to pocket that kind of cash.

Solution: Have thousands of retailers market your products for you

Don't throw an extra $8.67 Million dollars down the toilet for another year of maybes. Invest in an MLS system. What? Why? What's an MLS? What does it even stand for? Yep. I'm pretty sure that you've never even heard of a Multiple Listing Service unless you have experience in the real-estate market.

The retail market has been using Multiple Listing Service systems to explode their profits since the late 1800s by letting other companies sell their properties for them. Now it's time for the retail market to start using that same power. That's where I come in. I'll build you the tools you need for this new superpower for your company.

Now you can go on vacation

Don't spend another day driving to work without your umbrella as it starts to rain and you spend the day soaked in water and employee-deficiency. Become the corporate hero you're meant to be. Once you have your new superpower, the Multiple Listing Service tool that your competition isn't using, you'll be well on your way to hiring more workers to handle the tasks that currently bog you down. Splurge on a personal secretary, or perhaps you need two. You simply can't deal with all of the work and expect to make it to your kid's soccer game... or your romantic dinner with your wife... or... you know... your wedding.

So, what are you waiting for? Get your superpowers now, and go play hero!

Who is Rick Mac Gillis?

Rick Mac Gillis is dedicated to continually advancing his skills as a Software Engineer. His three greatest passions are in API development, Artificial Intelligence, and proper algorithm and data structure design and implementation.

Rick has contributed to the Computer Science industry in many ways. He has devoted time to improving open source projects, such as the PHP RAML Parser project and the Fuel PHP Framework. He created Hack Fast Algos, an open source algorithm library designed to aid aspiring Software Engineers in their quest for algorithmic knowledge. Rick also programs for charity at the Cleveland Give Camp Hackathon.

Rick's first exposure to programming was the summer after sixth grade when he was only 12 years old. He started programming in QBasic back in the days of old DOS systems. However, it wasn't until 2003, when he began his college career, that he really started to take programming seriously.

His teacher gave him a self-study project where he could choose one of several projects to complete, and he started learning HTML. He dropped out of college as he just couldn't bring himself to stop programming!

Rick was fascinated by HTML, and he was excited by the prospect that he could write anything into existence in a very simple language... or so he though. A few months later, he needed more functionality, and so he began creating dynamic websites in PHP with a MySQL database backend. Shortly after, he started working with APIs and integrating other website content with his own.

Over the years, Rick has created extraordinary software, such as a prototype API Optimization Engine, and he literally wrote the book on API best practices. His book is entitled, "The New Frontier in Web API Programming."

Core Business Values

Make life easier for my clients

Doesn't it feel great when someone takes the load off of your back so you can focus on what's important to you? Making your life easier is integral to providing you with an awesome experience, and therefore it's my first core value.

Make sure that I fully understand my client's situation

Every project is unique, and once I understand your needs, I can build you a custom solution tailored to your needs.

Put my art into it and seek a win-win situation or don't make the deal

Every project I create is an artistic and scientific creation of the highest quality. I'm selective about the projects on which I choose to work. When I select you as a client, I genuinely care about the quality I provide.

Naturally, I'm unable to take on every project I'm offered, though once I've committed to a project, I like to work on that project exclusively until it's finished. I'm quite confident that you'll love what I build for you as we work together on your project.

In fact, I'm so confident that I can offer you the highest-quality work, that I offer a 30-Day Bug-Free Guarantee. If you find a bug in my code within 30 days of finishing the contract, I'll repair it at no additional charge.

Dennis Jarecke

Dennis Jarecke on The New Frontier in Web API Programming

Serial Entrepreneur and Full Stack Web Developer Rick Mac Gillis reveals the next evolution in web programming.

Today the stakes are higher. Much higher. Chief Technology Officers and developers must insure their projects and web infrastructure can withstand the onslaught of increasingly complex API calls... even on top of the slow and antiquated TCP/IP stack.

Rick explains where the industry is currently at, and more importantly, what the future holds for CTOs and developers who must deliver superior results to their clients and their businesses.

Rick shows what you can do today to insure minimal, robust code that's shockingly easy to maintain AND at speeds well beyond your competition. Rick puts your team on the cutting edge of web technology with simple strategies and insights that only an industry veteran can deliver.
